meanings.definition: Acroliths: statues made of a combination of stone and wood
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient acroliths that were a mix of stone and wood.
meanings.sent2: Visitors admired the intricate details of the acroliths in the art gallery.
meanings.sent3: The acroliths in the park seemed to come alive at night, playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Heritage sites are like acroliths, blending different elements to create something unique.
meanings.sent5: The acroliths stood tall, telling stories of ancient craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: Acroliths: sculptures with stone heads and extremities and wooden bodies
meanings.sent1: The acroliths in the temple had stone heads and wooden bodies, creating a striking contrast.
meanings.sent2: Art enthusiasts marveled at the beauty of the acroliths showcased at the exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The acroliths at the art fair were so realistic, visitors mistook them for living beings.
meanings.sent4: In a world of conformity, be an acrolith - a blend of different materials, yet uniquely beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The acroliths in the garden seemed to whisper ancient secrets to those who listened.
